Fixed issue with hide pinned and hide protected not having effect Fixed screenshot privacy setting not working on app relaunch Fixed biometrics prompt activation issues Fixed automatic color scheme handling Added Upload link files button to linking menu
Fixed navigation button not showing up on iPad Fixed links in editor not opening in external browser Added per tag display preferences

Added ability to star notes Added ability to favorite tags You can now select a custom icon for tags Improved plaintext editor performance Moved New note button to floating action button Fixed editor width Fixed help feedback links not opening in browser Fixed lock screen buttons not working
Fixes and improvements.
Breaking Changes: You will need to re enable Dark mode in the new mobile experience since we had to make some changes to fix some issues with it.
Fixes and improvements.

Breaking Changes: The experimental Advanced Checklist editor has been deprecated and moved to our community plugins directory. If you opted into this experimental feature in the past please reinstall the editor from the plugins directory. Features: Added Delete account option in settings And other fixes improvements.
Fixes and improvements.
Fixes and improvements.
Fixes and improvements.
Fixes and improvements.
Fixes and improvements.
Fixes and improvements.
Fixes and improvements.
Fixes and improvements
Fixes issue in 3.20.0 where changing note types would have no effect Support for encrypted file attachments

New: No more Potentially Out of Sync ! When the app detects you may be out of sync with the server it will talk with the server to figure out and correct the discrepancy automatically. Fixed: Modifying metadata of a note pinned archived etc will no longer change its timestamps.
NEW: Ability to publish to and create a new Listed blog https: listed.to .
Improved decryption performance on launch.
Fixed: Issue where notes without title would have an extra whitespace above the note contents.
New: Render tag hierarchies created in the desktop app New: Show editor icon for notes in notes list. These icons can be hidden from the Settings menu.
Fixed: Issue when creating a new note with a default editor set wouldn t insert that note.
Fixes issue on iPad where selecting notes using the same editor wouldn t update note display.

New: offline editors. Now editors like Markdown Pro and TokenVault work with no internet connection required! Network connectivity is only required for the initial download. Other bug fixes and improvements.
Fix: use internal endpoint for checking network reachability state.
Fixed: Issue when changing editors multiple times results in editor not loading correct data
Fixed: Potentially out of sync issue for some users who have interacted with 2FA enable disable multiple times in the past.
Fixes issue where application could turn white and unresponsive on launch.
Potential fix for crash on launch issue. If you re still experiencing issues you can help us track down the issue better by enabling error reporting from the application settings.
Fixes issue where account backups would not be exported properly in some cases

Fixed: The application would prompt for a password when attempting to import a decrypted backup. Fixed: When an editor failed to load the Unable to load message would not show the editor s name. Fixed: Highlight on pressed notes when scrolling through the notes list.
Fixed: Last line of text was unreachable when the Unable to load editor banner was displayed on a long note.
Fixed: Issue where restoring expired session would not perform sync afterwards. Fixed: Issue where the active tag would not be applied to a new note created with a non plain editor.

Fixed: Issue where app would not properly sync after having been offline and regaining network connection changes were correctly saved offline . This regression was introduced in version 3.6.20 and fixed in this release. Fixed: Reverting a note to a previous revision is now disallowed if the note has editing disabled. Internal API upgrades.
Internal API upgrades.
Internal API upgrades.
Internal API upgrades.
Internal API upgrades.
Fixed: Error on sign in for users with two factor authentication enabled.
Fixed: Issue where backups with spaces on their filenames could not be correctly imported. Internal API upgrades.
Internal API upgrades.
Improved: Tag titles are now case insensitive.

New: Backups can now be imported on mobile. Improved: When switching default editors a previously created note will now keep using the previous editor. Improved: Error reporting is now opt in disabled by default . Fixed: Issue where restarting the app would not show the last selected tag. Fixed: Issue where the start syncing status message would display for too long. Fixed: Issue where the app would crash when scanning a QR code for the TokenVault extension because of a missing camera usage description.

Improved: Searching no longer includes archived and trashed notes by default. Fixed: Incorrect Potentially Out of Sync message. Fixed: In some situations swiping left or right to reveal the respective menus would not work. Fixed: Issue where local history entries would show an incorrect timestamp when offline. Fixed: Typo in Potentially Out of Sync error message.

Fixed: Issue where the multitasking privacy setting was not preserved between app launches. Fixed: Issue where typing quickly on the search bar would overwrite previous characters. Fixed: Issue where in some cases the note editor while open pulled in but did not immediately display changes made from other devices.

Fixed: Rare issue where in certain conditions changing the currently selected note rapidly or while it was syncing could result in a race condition where the editor would swap contents of the previous note with the newly selected one. Fixed: Improved note Saving status display accuracy. Fixed: Disallows editor switching for Locked notes.
Fixes an issue when signing in with non upgraded account types.

New: Option in Settings to enable or disable multitasking screenshot privacy enabled by default . You can find this under the Security section. New: Adding a passcode is now a protected action. Fixed: Issue where Syncing message would sometimes display after syncing had concluded.

New: Search options allow you to choose whether to include protected notes contents archived notes and trashed notes in search results. New: Protected View when opening a protected note without having any protection sources enabled account passcode or biometrics lock . Fixed: Issue where the Previous Installation Detected alert showed up immediately after signing out. Fixed: Issue where the notes list didn t scroll to top when changing views or performing searches. Any questions Email us anytime at help standardnotes.org

New: Session Management allows you to view which devices are currently signed into your account as well as the ability to revoke that session and remove your data from that device. Data removal feature requires all devices to be running v3.6 New: Protections is a new feature that improves on the previous Privileges feature. Now sensitive actions automatically require authenticating with your passcode biometrics or account password. Sensitive actions include viewing protected notes exporting a backup and changing certain preferences. Fixed: Issue where having a passcode set to Immediate but biometrics set to On Quit would still prompt for biometrics immediately. Improved: The application will now always blur when it is in your multi tasking view. Previously it would only blur if you had a passcode biometrics set to require Immediately. Improved: Protected notes will no longer appear in search results unless their title matches the search query. Improved: Protected notes now have a more subtle Protected indicator rather than a very conspicuous rectangle that makes it very obvious when scrolling that a note is protected. You ll see this label to the left of the note s date in your list of notes. Fixed: Issue where gear icon did not achieve maximal optimal perfect sub atomic vertical centering. Thanks to everyone who reported this in! Any questions Email us anytime at help standardnotes.org

New: Session Management allows you to view which devices are currently signed into your account as well as the ability to revoke that session and remove your data from that device. Data removal feature requires all devices to be running v3.6 New: Protections is a new feature that improves on the previous Privileges feature. Now sensitive actions automatically require authenticating with your passcode biometrics or account password. Sensitive actions include viewing protected notes exporting a backup and changing certain preferences. Standard Notes 3.5 is a rigorous architectural upgrade that brings greatly improved performance new state of the art encryption algorithms and a solid logical foundation on which we ll be able to build new features with greater speed and confidence. While the majority of this release consists of under the hood improvements that are hard to see this upgrade brings a few long requested features and improvements: A built in dark theme! Session and remote history for long term undo redo support. You can access the history for any note by opening the right side menu in the note editor then selecting History An improved architecture that will make it easier to develop and maintain new features in the future When you use this release with v3.5 on desktop and web you ll gain access to our latest and greatest encryption upgrade featuring the latest state of the art encryption algorithms to protect your data We hope you enjoy what we ve been working hard on over the last 10 months! Any questions Email us anytime at help standardnotes.org. From version 3.5.12 Standard Notes supports only devices with iOS 10 or newer.

Fixes issue on iPad where the active note could potentially not change after list item selection.
Fixes issue where themes would not properly activate when selected for first time. Other bug fixes and improvements.

Adds ability to specify existing themes as either the Dark Mode default or Light Mode default. You can access these options by long pressing on a theme. Removes splash screen for new users that required them to sign in or register and instead shows a non obtrusive banner in the list of notes reminding users to register to keep their notes backed up.
Adds ability to use application without an account as an advanced mode of usage.
Underlying framework modernization.
Internal improvements.

Adds ability to change local passcode keyboard type from input screen. Fixes issue where adding a new passcode with a default keyboard type with previously deactivated numeric passcode would not retain default keyboard type preference.
Low level framework updates.
Fixes issue where right side menu on iPad could render blank From 3.0.13: Adds option to hide notes list and enter fullscreen mode on iPad
Adds option to hide notes list and enter fullscreen mode on iPad
Fixes issue where left side menu could open with blank content
Fixes issue on iOS 13 where scrollbar could appear incorrectly positioned Fixes issue where existing users could not sign in on iOS 13
Underlying improvements to sync and conflict resolution engine.

This release: Fixes issue where closing app with fingerprint set to immediate would sometimes flash the fingerprint authentication alert while closing. Fixes issue from 3.0.6 where some Extended editors would not load. Fixes issue where link clicks in Extended editors opened pages inline. Link clicks via Extended editors will now open in your browser. Fixes issue where using Extended editors resulted in a slight jump when accessing toolbar options. Fixes issue where requiring all three authentication types account password local passcode and Touch ID Face ID for a privileged action could result in no action on submit.

Fixes issue from 3.0.6 where some Extended editors would not load. Fixes issue where link clicks in Extended editors opened pages inline. Link clicks via Extended editors will now open in your browser. Fixes issue where using Extended editors resulted in a slight jump when accessing toolbar options. Fixes issue where requiring all three authentication types account password local passcode and Touch ID Face ID for a privileged action could result in no action on submit.

Fixes issue where link clicks in Extended editors opened pages inline. Link clicks via Extended editors will now open in your browser. Fixes issue where using Extended editors resulted in a slight jump when accessing toolbar options. Fixes issue where requiring all three authentication types account password local passcode and Touch ID Face ID for a privileged action could result in no action on submit.

Fixes issue where entering Touch ID or Face ID after passcode could in very rare cases result in a failed unlock. More clearly distinguishes mobile default editor. You can long press on an editor to choose to make it your default mobile editor. When an Extended editor fails to load due to being offline you ll now be able to use the plain editor right away without having to switch. Fixes issue where Extended editor content could be hidden behind keyboard. Fixes issue on iPad where keyboard could block button to add new note.

More clearly distinguishes mobile default editor. You can long press on an editor to choose to make it your default mobile editor. When an Extended editor fails to load due to being offline you ll now be able to use the plain editor right away without having to switch. Fixes issue where Extended editor content could be hidden behind keyboard. Fixes issue on iPad where keyboard could block button to add new note.

Fixes issue where signing out may indicate it has completed signing out before actually completing. New from 3.0.2: Fixes issue where using the app on iPad in split view would prevent you from changing notes or creating new ones Most recent items are now loaded first on app launch resulting in a smoother loading experience

Fixes issue where using the app on iPad in split view would prevent you from changing notes or creating new ones Most recent items are now loaded first on app launch resulting in a smoother loading experience

Standard Notes 3.0 features a refreshed interface a smoother and more performant experience and powerful features like Privileges. Here s what s new: Privileges allow you to protect notes to require additional authentication to view or delete notes. An all new trash bin where deleted notes are placed. Trashed notes can be recovered or deleted permanently. A cleaner and more polished UI consistent with the desktop experience. The ability to set an editor as default by long pressing it. Smart tags are now available on mobile so if you ve created any custom smart tags via the Folders extension they ll now appear here. Reverse sorting option. Revamped Extended themes for smoother thicker themes. Data backups can now be exported to other applications instead of just an email attachment. And lots lots more improvements and fixes. We hope you enjoy this 3.0 update! Please be sure to also update Standard Notes on your desktop to version 3.0.3 for the most consistent cross platform experience.

Fixes issue where app would crash during load for some users Fixes issue where editor would not be properly sized in iPad split view Remove scrolling view for web editors. Now your note will default to your web editor if applicable. If you want to switch to the plain editor press the Manage button then select Use Plain in the Edit With section.

Added options to hide note previews note tags and note dates in list of notes accessible via Filter screen . Extended editors now appear inline and not as a separate pop up. Swipe horizontally to switch between the web editor and plain editor. Previews for web editors no longer display raw markup and instead display cleaner previews.

Offline users will now see their last export date in the Account menu. This is to remind offline users that it is their responsibility to keep regular backups of their data. Otherwise you are encouraged to sign up for a free sync account to keep your data backed up automatically. Remove refresh control for non signed in sessions On iOS web editor cache is now cleared after every app update rather than after every app launch. This will result in quicker loading times for web editor extensions. Fixes issue where navigating away from Compose while Saving... does not remove that text when you return. Search now dismisses the keyboard when you submit.

Fixes issue where creating a new note when a tag filter is enabled does not save that tag to that note. Fixes issue where a note which was affected by the previously fixed sync conflict duplicate note issue was unable to be deleted these notes can now be deleted .
Fixes issue where a sync conflict can create many copies of a note that can t be deleted.

Fixes slow loading issue some users may have encountered. Fixes issue where removing a tag from an old note would not take effect. No longer updates the modified date of a note when locking or unlocking it.

This update features large scale improvements in the underlying architecture related to sync and note management. In addition this update includes an initial load progress indicator. Be sure to also upgrade to 2.3.1 on your desktop for the most consistent experience.

2.3.2 fixes the Loading notes screen that offline users may have seen during the last update. This update features large scale improvements in the underlying architecture related to sync and note management. In addition this update includes an initial load progress indicator. Be sure to also upgrade to 2.3.1 on your desktop for the most consistent experience.

This update features large scale improvements in the underlying architecture related to sync and note management. In addition this update includes an initial load progress indicator. Be sure to also upgrade to 2.3.0 on your desktop for the most consistent experience.

New in 2.2.11: Displays alert if sign in session expires. New in 2.2.1: Fixes issue with Simple Markdown Editor where selecting a tab option would cause a crash. New in 2.2: Incremental loading makes app start up faster. Improved external editors load time. Fixes third party keyboards compatibility issues. Fixes issue where deleting notes while offline would not sync them after regaining connectivity. Fixes issue where choosing to export Decrypted backups would create an encrypted file. Introduces Strict sign in security option. Learn more at standardnotes.org help security.

New in 2.2.1: Fixes issue with Simple Markdown Editor where selecting a tab option would cause a crash. New in 2.2: Incremental loading makes app start up faster. Improved external editors load time. Fixes third party keyboards compatibility issues. Fixes issue where deleting notes while offline would not sync them after regaining connectivity. Fixes issue where choosing to export Decrypted backups would create an encrypted file. Introduces Strict sign in security option. Learn more at standardnotes.org help security.

Incremental loading makes app start up faster. Improved external editors load time. Fixes third party keyboards compatibility issues. Fixes issue where deleting notes while offline would not sync them after regaining connectivity. Fixes issue where choosing to export Decrypted backups would create an encrypted file. Introduces Strict sign in security option. Learn more at standardnotes.org help security.

Fixes issue where creating a new note then pressing back without making changes would create an empty note. Fixes issue for possible race condition that occurs during sign in where some data may be duplicated. If for some reason you still see this issue after this update please email us directly with any relevant information: hello standardnotes.org. As always you can use the Batch Manager extension on desktop and web to automatically detect and clean duplicates.

Fixes issue where presenting and dismissing an editor causes Manage button not to work. Sorry for the failed fix attempts in previous versions. The issue manifested itself in more ways than we accounted for. We hope you don t see this issue anymore but if you do please reach out to us at hello standardnotes.org. Removes default editor loading. Previous versions of the app inadvertently loaded your default desktop editor when you created a new note. On mobile we recommend using the plain editor for new notes and using the desktop based editors for viewing your marked up data and if necessary making minor modifications.

Fixes an issue where the Manage button would not function properly if returning from an editor. Fixes an issue where a note s modified date isn t updated right away if you re using the app without an account. Fixes an issue where having a passcode enabled and set to immediately interferes with your ability to exit the app and retrieve your 2FA code. Editors! You can now access your Extended editors right on mobile. Tap Manage in the compose window to choose an editor for a note. Note: editors must be already installed from the desktop web app for them to appear on mobile. If they don t appear please sign out then sign back in. Editors were previously ignored in sync so a fresh sync may be required.

2.1.33 fixes an issue where web editors wouldn t respect a note s locked state. 2.1.30 includes..Editors! You can now access your Extended editors right on mobile. Tap Manage in the compose window to choose an editor for a note. Note: editors must be already installed from the desktop web app for them to appear on mobile. If they don t appear please sign out then sign back in. Editors were previously ignored in sync so a fresh sync may be required.

Editors! You can now use your Extended editors to read and edit notes. Click Manage in the compose window to choose an editor for a note. Note: editors must be already installed from the web desktop app for them to appear on mobile. If they still don t appear please sign out then sign back in. Editors were previously ignored in sync so a fresh sync may be required. If you have any questions please visit our help page at standardnotes.org help or shoot us an email at hello standardnotes.org.
Improved syncing under poor network conditions. Questions Get in touch anytime: hello standardnotes.org
Adds option to lock note to prevent unintended editing.

Adds support for two factor authentication 2FA is a paid feature available to Extended members. Learn more at https: standardnotes.org help 25 Adds Clear button to tags list to quickly clear filters Face ID support
Fixes an issue that may occur when restoring your device from an iCloud backup.

Fixes an issue where closing your device for the second time when a note is open may not retrieve latest note changes when you re open your device. Any questions Please don t hesitate to reach out to us at hello standardnotes.org.
Fixes issue where signing in with existing data present may cause a sync conflict
You can now long press on a note or tag to bring up options like pin archive delete and share. Any questions Please reach out to us any time at hello standardnotes.org.
